name: Bacon-Wrapped Bourbon-Marinated Salmon
author: Tammy
summary: I serve this as a main dish, appetizer, or whatever you desire. Bacon and seafood lovers' delight. You can always tweak things to your family's taste.
ingredients: ½ cup steak seasoning sauce (such as Dale's Steak Seasoning®)
2 tablespoons bourbon (such as Jim Beam®), or more to taste
½ pound bacon strips, cut in half
directions: Mix steak seasoning sauce, 6 tablespoons brown sugar, bourbon, and scallions together in a large bowl to make marinade
Cover with plastic wrap and let sit in the refrigerator, 4 to 6 hours
Wrap each salmon cube with bacon; use a toothpick to hold bacon in place
Sprinkle remaining 2 tablespoons brown sugar on top
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate
Grill bacon-wrapped salmon, turning frequently, until bacon begins to crisp, about 5 minutes
